conclusion: The speed of the positive particle stays constant because the magnetic force is always perpendicular to the velocity.
In the upper field B1, the radius is r1 = mv/qB1 and angular speed is ω1 = qB1/m.
In the lower field B2, the radius is r2 = mv/qB2 and angular speed is ω2 = qB2/m.
Given B1 = 2B2, it follows that r2 = 2r1.
In the upper field B1, the particle moves clockwise through a half-circle until it meets the interface again at P1 with velocity downward.
Time taken in upper field B1 is t1 = πm/qB1.
In the lower field B2, the particle sweeps another half-circle clockwise to P2, now moving upward.
Time taken in lower field B2 is t2 = πm/qB2.
Crossing back into the B1 region at P2, the particle describes a half-circle and arrives at O with velocity downward.
Time taken in upper field B1 again is t3 = πm/qB1.
Total time to re-cross O downward is t_total = 2πm/qB1 + πm/qB2.
With B1 = 2B2, total time is t_total = 4πm/qB1 = 2πm/qB2.
The charged particle will pass through point O again, now moving downward, after a time t = 4πm/qB1 = 2πm/qB2.
